title: How to Find, Catch & Release Sand Crabs

steps.title: Find a beach, gather your stuff, and head off.
steps.content: Find a beach, gather your stuff, and head off.

steps.title: Start heading towards the water.
steps.content: Start heading towards the water. If it's too cold, try to get used to the temperature.

steps.title: Find a place where the water goes up to you and goes back to the ocean.
steps.content: Find a place where the water goes up to you and goes back to the ocean. This is what the sand crabs need so they don't escape when you don't want them to and so they don't get too dried out. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Look for a spot near the shore where there are small "V"s that appear as the wave rolls out.
steps.content: Look for a spot near the shore where there are small "V"s that appear as the wave rolls out. The "V" is the set of antennae that belong to a sand crab.

steps.title: Once you've found a spot, dig a hole.
steps.content: Once you've found a spot, dig a hole. You don't need a hole as deep as an abyss. You want one about half of a foot deep. [2] X Research source

steps.title: When the water comes, start digging just a little.
steps.content: When the water comes, start digging just a little. When you start digging, it's likely that a sand crab will start swimming around in the puddle.

steps.title: When you see the sand crab swim, try your best to use both hands and catch it.
steps.content: When you see the sand crab swim, try your best to use both hands and catch it. Sand crabs like to bury themselves in the sand so try to be quick. When you hold it in your hands, don't crush the sand crab before it goes back into the water.

steps.title: If digging around a "V", pick up the sand around a "V".
steps.content: If digging around a "V", pick up the sand around a "V". Let the crab crawl out of the sand while in your hands or on a flat surface.

steps.title: If you plan to keep the crab for a while, place it in a bucket filled with moist sand.
steps.content: If you plan to keep the crab for a while, place it in a bucket filled with moist sand.

steps.title: When you've held it long enough, set it free.
steps.content: When you've held it long enough, set it free. Wild animals don't like to be held captive. [3] X Research source
